title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.9.30 | 27-04-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyana Timiran Dhasya Gyanan Janishalakaya
Chakshuran Militam Yena Tasmai Sri Gurave Namaha
Nama Om Vishnupadaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale
Srimate Bhaktivedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine
Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Pashchatya Deshatarine
Jaya Sri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda
Sri Advaita Gadadhara Shiva Sadhi Gauravakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare
Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya
Narayanam Namaskritya Naram Chai Vanarottamam
Deveem Saraswateem Vyasam Tato Jayam Udi Rayet
In this session we will be discussing from the 30th verse
of the 9th chapter of the 1st Canto Shloka.
Srimad Bhagavatam
Tadopa Samhritya Girasahasranir
Vimukta Sangam Mana Adipurushe
Krishne Lasat Peetapate Chaturbhuje
Purasthite Meelita Dhrigvydharayat
The meaning of this verse is
Thereupon that man who spoke on different subjects
with thousands of meanings
and who fought on thousands of battlefields
and who fought on thousands of battlefields
protected thousands of men
stopped speaking
and being completely freed from all bondage
withdrew his mind from everything else
and fixed his wide open eyes
upon the original personality of God at Sri Krishna
who stood before him
four-handed
dressed in yellow garments
that glittered and shined.
So something very interesting here
is happening.
Bhishma has stopped speaking.
He was instructing the Pandavas.
The Uttarayana Punikala has arrived
the auspicious time for him to quit the body
and he stopped speaking.
Now after stopping speaking
he withdrew his mind from everything else
and fixed his eyes
and thereby even his mind
upon the original personality of God at Sri Krishna.
upon the original personality of God at Sri Krishna.
upon the original personality of God at Sri Krishna.
Sri Krishna was right in front of Bhishma.
Remember, Krishna came along with the Pandavas
to that spot where Bhishma was lying
on the battlefield
on the bed of arrows.
So Krishna is front of Bhishma
Bhishma fixed his attention
his eyes
his sight
completely on Krishna.
Now how did Krishna appear to Bhishma Deva?
Krishna appeared in a four-handed form to Bhishma Deva.
Why?
Because Bhishma's relationship with the Supreme Personality of Godhead
is as the four-handed Narayana dressed in yellow garments.
Four-handed Narayana dressed in yellow garments.
That is the relationship of the Lord and Bhishma Deva.
That is the relationship of the Lord and Bhishma Deva.
That is the relationship of the Lord and Bhishma Deva.
So the Supreme Lord is one
and his original form is the two-handed
Shyama Sundara form
Krishna form.
Even Krishna as Shyama Sundara
is the form in which he relates with the Gopis
the young Gopis headed by Radharani.
The same Krishna is present as a small child.
The same Krishna is present as a small child.
The same Krishna is present as a small child.
The same Krishna is present as a small child.
The same Krishna is present as a small child.
The same Krishna is present as a small child.
The same Krishna is present as a small child.
The same Krishna is present as a small child.
The same Krishna is present as a small child.
The same Krishna is present as a five-year-old boy,
the same Krishna is present as a five-year-old boy,
the same Krishna is present as a five-year-old boy,
the same Krishna is present as a five-year-old boy,
the same Krishna is present as a five-year-old boy,
the same Krishna is present as a five-year-old boy,
the same Krishna is present as a five-year-old boy,
the same Krishna is present as a five-year-old boy,
the same Krishna is present as a five-year-old boy,
covered boyfriends and the same Krishna is present before the Pandavas as the king of
Dwarka as the king of Dwarka and the same Krishna is present before Bhishma Deva in
this form as the four-handed Narayana. So the same supreme Lord is present in different forms
according to the relationship of the devotees with the Lord. So Lord is one but his forms are
according to the relationship the devotee has with the Lord and this relationship is a spiritual
relationship.
It is nothing to do with the material body that we have at present
The material situations we are in
It is nothing to do with this material world or material situation or circumstances
It is totally different than this material situation
So it will be explained by Prabhupada this particular point
In the momentous hour of leaving this material body
Bhishma Deva set the glorious example concerning the important function of the human form of life
Of all the different species of life in this material world
The most important form is the human form
The human form of life
The Bhagavatam says
Durlabham manusham janma
It is very very very rare that a living being in this material world gets the human form
It is very rare because there are millions and billions and trillions of living beings
In so many different forms
Insects and birds and animals and aquatics and plants
And trees and shrubs and reptiles
And all kinds of other life forms are there
And they outnumber the human form
Just like if I stand in a particular place
Just say I occupy about 6 inches by 6 inches square
Flat land
Now if I dig just 1 inch down into that 6 inches by 6 inches square
There will be millions of microbes inside that
There will be so many worms
There could be so many insects
So many worms
So we have no idea that the human form of life is very rare
It is very rare
And it is very precious because
In the human form of life
The most important function
Is to prepare ourselves
To get out of this material existence
The essence of which is misery
The essence of material existence is misery
In any form
In any place
In the material world
There are always miseries
And we don't want miseries
We are always
We are always
Desiring happiness
We always want to be joyful
We always want to be satisfied
We want eternal life
So that is possible
By preparing ourselves
In the human form of life
To quit the body
In the way Bhishma Deva is teaching us
By preparing ourselves
To quit the body
In proper consciousness
Then we
Go to the spiritual world
For eternal life
Without any difficulty
We are
Directly
Transferred immediately
If we are
In the right conscious
In the time of death
So it is explained by Prabhupada further
The subject matter which attracts
the dying man
Becomes the beginning of his next life
This is the Science
Described in the Bhagavat Gita
It is said, that ils invecousوا
In this body there is a final moment of life in this body
That is called the moment of death
At that time whatever is the subject matter that is attracting the person who is quitting the body
Who is dying
That becomes the basis of the beginning of the next life
So Prabhupada says
Therefore if one is absorbed in thoughts of the Supreme Lord Sri Krishna
He is sure to go back to Godhead without any doubt
So how is perfection attained in this uniformed life?
To be absorbed in thoughts of the Supreme Lord Sri Krishna
Always
So that even at the time of death
We are absorbed in thought of Krishna
We go back to Krishna Loka
Where we belong
Otherwise if we have some other thoughts
We have to take birth again in this material world
Again we will take birth
Which means that continuation of suffering the miseries of material existence
So if you want to put an end to all
Material miseries
And want eternal life
Full of bliss and knowledge
In this spiritual world
In association with Krishna
Then you should practice
Absorbing
Your mind
In thoughts of Krishna
And how is this done?
Srila Prabhupada explains in the introduction to the Bhagavad Gita
This is most easily practiced by
Practicing
Chanting of Hare Krishna
Hare Krishna
Krishna Krishna
Hare Hare
Hare Rama
Hare Rama
Rama Rama
Hare Hare
So in the Bhagavad Gita
This is explained very elaborately
In the 8th chapter verses 5 to 15
5 to 15 Krishna says in the Bhagavad Gita
Whoever at the time of death quits his body remembering me alone
That means remembering Krishna
At once attains my nature
Of this there is no doubt
Krishna's nature is completely transcendental
So one will get spiritual nature
And the general rule is
Whatever state of being one remembers
When he quits his body
That state he will attain without fail
So Krishna tells Arjuna
Therefore Arjuna
Should always think of me in the form of Krishna
And at the same time carry out your prescribed duty of fighting
With your activities dedicated to me and your mind and intelligence
And if your mind is fixed on me
You will attain me without doubt
Tasmat sarveshu kaaleshu
All the time if we are
Practiced thinking of Krishna
By mind being absorbed in Krishna
Even while doing our routine duties
Maa Manusmara Yudhya Cha
Krishna says two things
You remember me and you also do your duties
So that is to be practiced
That has to be practiced
So Prabhupada says you practice chanting Hare Krishna
So even while you are doing ordinary work
You practice chanting Hare Krishna
It is a matter of the consciousness
The background consciousness with which we do any activity
That is important
He who meditates on the Supreme Personality of Godhead
His
Mind constantly engaged in remembering me
Undeviated from the path he
O Arjuna is sure to reach me
So Krishna is describing
And in the scriptures
There are two different recommendations
One is the method of Ashtanga Yoga
Other one is the method of Bhakti Yoga
So Ashtanga Yoga method is
One who at the time of death fixes his life air
Between the eyebrows
Between the eyebrows
And in full devotion engages himself in remembering the Supreme Lord
Will certainly attain to the Supreme Personality of Godhead
This is the Ashtanga Yoga method
And then there are the Jnanis
Who practice chanting Om
For them it is described
Persons learned in the Vedas
Jnanis
They should study the Vedas
They should study the Vedas
Who utter Omkara
And who enter into Brahman
And who are great sages in the renounced order
Enter into Brahman
So this is three different
The Jnana process
The Yoga process
Ashtanga Yoga process
And the Bhakti process
The Bhakti process is
Simply to be engaged in devotional service
And in that state of
Always being engaged in devotional service
One simply quits the body whenever
Anytime
And simply goes back to Godhead
So that is the advantage for the Bhakti Yogis
As opposed to the Ashtanga Yogis and the Jnana Yogis
The Jnana Yogis very very difficult process
Ashtanga Yoga also very difficult process
Bhakti Yoga is the easy process
So therefore the Bhagavad Gita recommends practice Bhakti Yoga
So therefore the Bhagavad Gita recommends practice Bhakti Yoga
And in Bhakti Yoga
The easiest method of practicing Bhakti
Is also described as chanting the Hare Krishna Mantra
I will stop here
Thank you very much
Hare Krishna
